description: Triangle in which j-th entry in i-th row is (j+1)^(i-j).
comments: Read as a square array this is the Hilbert transform of triangle A123125 (see A145905 for the definition of this term). For example, the fourth row of A123125 is (0,1,4,1) and the expansion (x + 4*x^2 + x^3)/(1-x)^4 = x + 8*x^2 + 27*x^3 + 64*x^4 + ... generates the entries in the fourth row of this array read as a square. - _Peter Bala_, Oct 28 2008
references: M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards Applied Math. Series 55, 1964 (and various reprintings), p. 24.
